related-activity.ref: 0990/A0/06/005 PREPARATION A L URGENCE ET TRANSITION

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: IR5.3 : Community resilience and social actors in the transitional areas is increased through sustainable increase in access to basic social services and capacity-building of community structures to manage conflict-related risks.

description.narrative: In 2019, the Participatory Empowering Approaches for Resilience (PEAR III) programme provided 256,000 people with a protective environment for children by improving access to social services in order to promote reconciliation between communities in conflict and community-based resilience. | Status:Met | As-of Date:08/02/2020

title.narrative: # of communities that have received support from UNICEF to improve their access to essential social services AND to build their capacity to manage the risks associated with the conflict.[# de communauts qui ont reu un appui d'UNICEF pour amliorer leur accs aux services sociaux de base ET pour renforcer leur capacit grer les risques associs au conflit. ]

actual.value:
2019:In the PTA 2019, the indicator is the number of people reached with a multisectoral response through the PEAR+
Target: 800,000 (400,000 NK, 400,000 Ituri) Results : 256,000
